item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] overview.ai å‹æƒ…ä»£æ‹› - èƒ½çœ‹æ‡‚è‹±æ–‡çš„è¿›
item.content:encoded:
Company Overview

Overview.ai is a leading provider of AI-driven vision inspection systems designed to enhance manufacturing processes through cutting-edge technology. Our solutions help companies achieve superior efficiency, accuracy, and quality control in their production lines.

Founded by leaders from Tesla and top engineers from Silicon Valley, Overview.ai aims to become the largest and most innovative AI company in the manufacturing sector worldwide. We currently support some of the most innovative manufacturers globally, including SpaceX, Amazon, NVIDIA, Tesla, and Honda, among others. Our products are best-in-class, and our customers love Overview.ai because our AI is more accurate, easier to use, and simpler to deploy than any other solution on the market. We are committed to continuous innovation.

ç®€å†(éœ€è¦æœ‰è‹±æ–‡ç‰ˆæœ¬)è¯·ä½¿ç”¨ PDF æ ¼å¼å‘é€åˆ°æˆ‘çš„ä¸ªäººé‚®ç®±ï¼šaUB6dnouaW0= å› ä¸ºæ˜¯ä»£æ‹›ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ä¸ªäººé‚®ç®±æ¥ç®€å†äº†ï¼Œè¯·åŸºäºä¿¡ä»»æŠ•é€’ï¼Œæ³¨æ„ä¿æŠ¤å¥½éšç§ä¿¡æ¯ï¼ˆå›å¤´æˆ‘èƒ½è”ç³»ä¸Šä½ å°±è¡Œäº†ï¼‰ï¼Œä¸æ¸…æ¥šçš„åœ°æ–¹å¯ä»¥åœ¨å¸–å­é‡Œæé—®äº¤æµã€‚

ä¸‰ä»½ JD å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

Application Engineer

  • Location: Greater Jiangsu, Shanghai, Guangdong Provinces (China) [Shenzhen, Suzhou, Nantong, Shanghai]
  • Compensation: RMB 260,000 â€“ 528,000 per annum
  • Travel Requirement: 80% (Shenzhen, Shanghai, and other locations in China)

Role Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Applications Engineer with a background in electrical engineering and manufacturing to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the installation and implementation of our AI vision inspection systems at customer sites across China. You will also provide hands-on training to our clients, ensuring the successful integration of our technology into their manufacturing processes. Your ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships and drive project success will be key to your role.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Travel to customer locations (80% travel) across China, including Shenzhen, Shanghai, and other key manufacturing hubs, to install, configure, and optimize Overview.aiâ€™s vision inspection systems.
  • Provide technical training to customers on how to operate and maintain our AI systems.
  • Collaborate with customers to ensure projects stay on track and achieve successful outcomes.
  • Work closely with internal teams, including engineering and sales, to customize solutions based on customer needs.
  • Maintain strong relationships with customers to ensure satisfaction and address any technical challenges that may arise.
  • Serve as a technical advisor, troubleshooting and resolving on-site issues related to electrical engineering, controls, and CAD-based system configurations.
  • Collect and act on customer feedback to contribute to product improvement initiatives.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in manufacturing, with a solid understanding of CAD and controls engineering.
  • Experience with machine vision systems is a significant plus.
  • Native Mandarin speaker with fluency in English, both written and verbal.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage timelines and customer expectations effectively.
  • Excellent communication skills, with a focus on customer service and relationship management.
  • Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and adapt to changing priorities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with AI-driven or automated inspection systems.
  • Familiarity with manufacturing environments in China, especially in Shenzhen and Shanghai.

Controls Engineer

  • Location: Greater Jiangsu, Shanghai, Guangdong Provinces (China) [Shenzhen, Suzhou, Nantong, Shanghai]
  • Compensation: RMB 260,000 â€“ 528,000 per annum
  • Travel Requirement: 60-80% (Domestic travel to customer locations)

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled and adaptable Controls Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for installing, troubleshooting, and optimizing Overview.aiâ€™s AI vision inspection systems on various customer automation lines. These automation lines often involve a range of PLCs and communication protocols, so we need someone who can work across multiple systems, diagnose issues, and quickly identify solutions. Your expertise in electrical work, PLCs, and communication protocols will be essential in ensuring the smooth integration of our systems and the resolution of any technical challenges.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Install, configure, and troubleshoot Overview.aiâ€™s vision inspection systems across various automation lines, working with different PLCs and communication protocols, including Ethernet/IP, Profinet, Modbus, and OPC UA. Ensure seamless integration between our AI-powered cameras and other devices on the automation line by troubleshooting electrical signals and communication.
  • Use multimeters and oscilloscopes to debug electrical issues and fix problems related to signal quality, camera triggering, or inconsistent lighting.
  • Solve technical issues such as double triggering, improper camera responses, or electrical signal irregularities by adjusting system configurations or making modifications to PLC ladder logic.
  • Provide on-site support and technical guidance to customers, ensuring smooth system operation and the resolution of any challenges related to integration.
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to refine product features and address common customer pain points based on feedback from the field.
  • Assist with the development and implementation of training programs for customers to operate and maintain the systems effectively.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Electrical Engineering, Automation, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in automation projects, with expertise in multiple PLC systems (Ethernet/IP, Profinet, Modbus, OPC UA).
  • Hands-on experience troubleshooting electrical circuits using multimeters and oscilloscopes, including the ability to modify circuits (e.g., adding resistors or capacitors) to resolve signal issues.
  • Strong understanding of electrical principles, including the differences between NPN and PNP sensors, and how to troubleshoot these systems.
  • Familiarity with PLC ladder logic and its modification to troubleshoot issues.
  • Fluent in Mandarin and English (both written and verbal).
  • Excellent problem-solving and diagnostic skills, with a strong focus on practical solutions.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with AI-driven inspection systems or automated vision systems.
  • Familiarity with manufacturing environments, particularly in China, especially in regions such as Shenzhen and Shanghai.
  • Knowledge of additional communication protocols or automation technologies is a plus.

Forward-Deployed Software Engineer

  • Location: Greater Jiangsu, Shanghai, Guangdong Provinces (China) [Shenzhen, Suzhou, Nantong, Shanghai]
  • Compensation: RMB 260,000 â€“ 528,000 per annum
  • Travel Requirement: 60-80% (Domestic travel to customer locations)

Role Overview:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Forward-Deployed Software Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for deploying and integrating our AI-driven vision inspection systems with various manufacturing automation systems, including PLCs and MES platforms. You will use your deep experience in Node-RED and JavaScript to build seamless communication between our systems and customer environments, developing dashboards and workflows that drive operational success. The ideal candidate will have a strong software engineering background, along with extensive experience in manufacturing environments, allowing them to bridge the gap between technical development and real-world applications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Use Node-RED to interface with a variety of PLCs, MES, and manufacturing automation systems, enabling smooth communication and integration of Overview.aiâ€™s vision inspection systems.
  • Design and build custom dashboards and workflows in Node-RED to optimize the performance of customer systems and improve operational efficiency.
  • Work closely with customers to understand their specific needs and tailor solutions that integrate seamlessly with their existing manufacturing processes.
  • Provide technical leadership in deploying and configuring systems on-site, ensuring smooth installation and setup of the AI vision inspection systems.
  • Collaborate with internal engineering teams to develop and refine Node-RED-based solutions that meet customer requirements.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve any software or integration issues, ensuring that systems run smoothly and efficiently across all stages of deployment.
  • Provide feedback to the product team to continuously improve software tools and enhance the customer experience.
  • Train customers and internal teams on Node-RED workflows, dashboards, and best practices for system management.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. 3+ years of experience as a software engineer, with a strong focus on Node-RED and JavaScript development.
  • Extensive experience integrating systems with manufacturing automation platforms such as PLCs and MES.
  • Proven ability to design and build custom dashboards and workflows in Node-RED.
  • Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and the ability to translate that knowledge into practical software solutions.
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills, with a focus on real-time system integration and performance.
  • Fluency in Mandarin and English (written and verbal).
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to work directly with customers and internal teams to achieve technical goals.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with industrial automation systems and manufacturing technologies.
  • Experience working with AI-driven or automated inspection systems.
  • Familiarity with additional programming languages, frameworks, or tools used in manufacturing automation systems.

èƒŒæ™¯ï¼šæˆ‘ç”¨ä»¥ä¸‹çš„è„šæœ¬åœ¨å®¿ä¸»æœºä¸Šï¼Œåœ¨ wg0-ns ä¸Šï¼Œå¼€å¯äº†ä¸€ä¸ª wireguard æ¥å£
åœ¨å…¶ä»–æœºå™¨ä¸Šå¯ä»¥æ­£å¸¸ ping é€š wg0-ns è¿™ä¸ª namespace ä¸Šçš„ wg0
æˆ‘æƒ³é€šè¿‡è¿™ä¸ª wg0 ï¼Œåœ¨å…¶ä»–è®¾å¤‡ä¸Šè®¿é—®åˆ°å®¿ä¸»æœºæœåŠ¡ æ¯”å¦‚ http ssh ç­‰

#!/bin/bash
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip link del dev $WG_INTERFACE
ip netns del wg0-ns
ip netns add wg0-ns
ip link add dev $WG_INTERFACE type wireguard
ip link set $WG_INTERFACE netns wg0-ns
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip address add dev $WG_INTERFACE 192.168.11.8/24
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip -6 address add dev $WG_INTERFACE 'fd08:6381:11::8/64'
ip netns exec wg0-ns wg set $WG_INTERFACE private-key /etc/wg0/private.key
ip link add veth-host type veth peer name veth-ns netns wg0-ns
ip link set veth-host up
ip addr add 192.168.222.1/24 dev veth-host
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip link set veth-ns up
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip addr add 192.168.222.2/24 dev veth-ns
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip route add default via 192.168.222.1
iptables -t nat -I POSTROUTING 1 -s 192.168.222.0/24 -j MASQUERADE
ip netns exec wg0-ns sh -c "echo 'nameserver 114.114.114.114' > /etc/resolv.conf"
ip netns exec wg0-ns wg set $WG_INTERFACE peer $PEER_PUBKEY preshared-key /etc/wg0/preshared.key endpoint $PEER_ENDPOINT persistent-keepalive 60 allowed-ips 192.168.11.0/24,fd08:6381:11::/64
ip netns exec wg0-ns ip link set up dev $WG_INTERFACE

    Value + Value
    | Value - Value
    | Value * Value
    | Value / Value
    | Value % Value
    | Value ^ Value
    | Value & Value
    | Value | Value
    | Value << Value
    | Value >> Value
    | Value == Value
    | Value != Value
    | Value > Value
    | Value < Value
    | Value >= Value
    | Value <= Value
    | Value && Value
    | Value || Value
Assign:
    Ident = Value
    | Ident += Value
    | Ident -= Value
    | Ident *= Value
    | Ident /= Value
    | Ident %= Value
    | Ident ^= Value
    | Ident &= Value
    | Ident |= Value
    | Ident <<= Value
    | Ident >>= Value
Paren:
    ( Values )
FuncLike:
    Ident ( Values )
Values:
    <nothing>
    | ValuesNext
ValuesNext:
    Value
    | Value , ValuesNext
Ident:
    <the rust lang ident>

æ ·ä¾‹ä¹Ÿå¾ˆç®€å•

fn demo() {
    let mut ctx = DemoContext::default();
    //æ¡ä»¶
    ctx.exec(
        "(
            _assert(_if(1,2,3)==2),
            _assert(_if(-1,2,3)==3),
            )",
    );
    //å‡½æ•°
    ctx.exec(
        "(
            _fn(add,a+b,a,b),
            _assert(add(1)==1),
            _assert(add(1,2)==3),
            _assert(_call(add,1,2)==3)
            )",
    );
    //å¾ªç¯
    ctx.exec(
        "_log(_while,
            i=10,
            _while(i<100000,
                _if(i%10000==0,_log(i_is,i)),
                i+=1,
                i
            )
            )",
    );
    //é€’å½’
    ctx.exec(
        "(
            _fn(fib1,_if(n<2,a2,fib1(n-1,a2,a1+a2)),n,a1,a2),
            _fn(fib,fib1(n,1,1),n),
            _log(fib,fib(0),fib(1),fib(2),fib(3),fib(10),fib(19)),
            _assert(6765==fib(19))
            )",
    );
    //ä½œç”¨åŸŸ
    ctx.exec(
        "(
            _scope(a=100,_assert(a==100)),
            _scope(a=100,_scope(_assert(a==100))),
            _scope(a=100,a=200,_assert(a==200)),
            _scope(a=100,_scope(a=200),_assert(a==100)),
            _fn(f1,_assert(a==0)),
            _scope(a=100,_fn(f1,_assert(a==100))),
            _scope(a=100,_fn(f1,(a=200,_assert(a==200))),_assert(a==100))
            )",
    );
}

<!-- Dark mode switcher -->
<script>
  if (localStorage.getItem('darkEnabled') === 'true') {
    document.documentElement.style.backgroundColor = '#121212';
    document.documentElement.style.color = '#e0e0e0';
  }
  (function() {
      var darkScript = document.createElement('script');
      darkScript.src = 'https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/darkreader/4.9.58/darkreader.min.js';
      darkScript.onload = function() {
          var darkEnabled = localStorage.getItem('darkEnabled') === 'true';
          if(darkEnabled) {
              DarkReader.enable({
                  brightness: 100,
                  contrast: 90,
                  sepia: 10
              });
          }
          function setupSwitchTheme() {
              var switchThemeLink = document.querySelector('a[href="#switch-theme"]');
              if (switchThemeLink) {
                  switchThemeLink.textContent = darkEnabled ? 'äº®è‰²ä¸»é¢˜' : 'æš—è‰²ä¸»é¢˜';
                  switchThemeLink.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if(darkEnabled) {
                          DarkReader.disable();
                          switchThemeLink.textContent = 'æš—è‰²ä¸»é¢˜';
                          darkEnabled = false;
                          localStorage.setItem('darkEnabled', 'false');
                      } else {
                          DarkReader.enable({
                              brightness: 100,
                              contrast: 90,
                              sepia: 10
                          });
                          switchThemeLink.textContent = 'äº®è‰²ä¸»é¢˜';
                          darkEnabled = true;
                          localStorage.setItem('darkEnabled', 'true');
                      }
                  });
              }
          }
          if(document.readyState === 'loading'){
              document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', setupSwitchTheme);
          } else {
              setupSwitchTheme();
          }
      };
      document.head.appendChild(darkScript);
  })();
</script>

item.title: [æ¨å¹¿] Gemma 3 Online(Free to use)
item.content:encoded:
Introducing Gemma 3: The Future of AI Development

Welcome to the world of Gemma 3, Google's latest and most advanced iteration in the Gemma family of models. With over 100 million downloads and a vibrant community creating 60,000+ variants, Gemma 3 builds on this success with groundbreaking features and capabilities. Discover more about Gemma 3 and explore its potential at gemma-3.net.

Unveiling New Capabilities

Gemma 3 introduces multimodality, supporting both vision-language inputs and text outputs. With a context window of up to 128k tokens and support for over 140 languages, Gemma 3 enhances math, reasoning, and chat capabilities. Available in four sizes, from 1B to 27B parameters, these models are perfect for a range of applications. Learn more about these features at gemma-3.net.

Technical Innovations

Gemma 3's development involved optimized pre-training and post-training processes, using distillation, reinforcement learning, and model merging. This results in superior performance in math, coding, and instruction following. The model also includes a new tokenizer for improved multilingual support. Dive into the technical details at gemma-3.net.

Get Started with Gemma 3

Ready to explore Gemma 3? Use Google AI Studio for quick experimentation, download models from Hugging Face or Kaggle, and integrate them into your projects using popular tools like Hugging Face Transformers or PyTorch. With multiple deployment options, including Google GenAI API, Vertex AI, and Cloud Run, you can choose the best fit for your needs. Gemma 3 is designed to be accessible and efficient, running seamlessly on devices from phones to workstations.

Enhanced Safety and Accessibility

Gemma 3 includes rigorous safety protocols and the ShieldGemma 2 image safety classifier, ensuring responsible AI development. The open model architecture allows for customization and control, promoting safe and innovative applications.

Join the Gemmaverse today and experience the cutting-edge advancements of Gemma 3. Whether you're a developer, researcher, or AI enthusiast, Gemma 3 offers the tools and flexibility to drive your projects forward.

Start your journey with Gemma 3 now and unlock new possibilities in AI development!

item.title: [ç”Ÿæ´»] çªå‘å¥‡æƒ³å°†è‡ªå·±çš„è¦æ±‚å†™æˆäº†ä¼ªä»£ç å½¢å¼ï¼Œæ„Ÿè§‰ç¨‹åºçŒ¿ç›¸äº²æˆ–è€…æ‰¾æ¸¸æˆæ­å­ï¼ˆï¼‰æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å¯ä»¥å‚è€ƒè¿™ç§æ€è·¯
item.content:encoded:
å£°æ˜ï¼š

  • å¹¶ä¸æ˜¯çœŸçš„æ‰¾ï¼Œåªæ˜¯æ„Ÿè§‰å¦‚æœçœŸçš„è¦é€ä¸€å¼ ç¥¨æ‰¾äººé™ªæˆ‘çœ‹ï¼ˆæ˜¯çš„æˆ‘ç¡®å®æœ‰ä¸¤å¼ ç¥¨ï¼ˆç‚«è€€ï¼‰ï¼‰ï¼Œæˆ‘ä¼šè¿™æ ·æ ¹æ® XP å’Œå®ç”¨æ€§ï¼ˆï¼Ÿï¼‰æ¥åšå†³å®šã€‚

å ç”²ï¼š

  • ä»£ç æ°´å¹³ä¸æ€ä¹ˆæ ·ä¸”ç»ç’ƒå¿ƒï¼Œå¦‚æœè§‰å¾—å“ªé‡Œæœ‰é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¸Œæœ›èƒ½è¢«æŒ‡å‡ºé—®é¢˜è€Œä¸æ˜¯è¯´æˆ‘èœ><è¯´æˆ‘èœæˆ‘å°±å“­ï¼ˆä¸æ˜¯ï¼‰
  • æœ‰äº›å‡½æ•°çš„å…·ä½“å†…æ¶µä¸ä¸€å®šå’Œå‘½åå®Œå…¨å»åˆï¼ˆå¯¹æˆ‘è¯´çš„å°±æ˜¯ä½ leetcodeHardï¼‰ï¼Œå› ä¸ºä¸æ˜¯çœŸçš„æ‰¾æ‰€ä»¥å°±å†™ä¸ªåå­—ï¼Œå‘å‡ºæ¥ä¸»è¦æ˜¯ä¸ºäº†åšçœ‹å®˜ä¸€ç¬‘ï¼Œå¸Œæœ›ä¸è¦åšä»·å€¼åˆ¤æ–­ï¼Œéè¦åšæˆ‘ä¹Ÿä¸ä»‹æ„ä½†æˆ‘å¤§æ¦‚ç‡ä¸ä¼šè§£é‡Šçš„
const PRIORITY = [
  {1, c => c.code.codeforces.rating >= 2000},
  {2, c => leetcodeHard(c)},
  {3, c => c.singing.lesMiserables.canSingAllTunes && c.isV2EXer},
  {4, c => c.videoGame.theWitness.hasFullAchievements},
  {5, c => c.body.hand.isPretty && willingHoldHands(c) && c.isV2EXer}
];

const CONDITIONS = [
  c => isStudent(c),
  c => c.gender == male,
  c => c.major == "math" || "CS" || "EE",
  c => knowsLesMiserables(c)
];

const finalJudging = [
  c => c.code.codeforces.rating,
  c => -c.education.schoolRank,
  c => -c.education.majorRank,
  c => c.singing.ability
]

Candidate select(candidates) {
  vector<vector> priorityCandidates(4);

  for (c : candidates) {
    int x = 0;
    for (p : PRIORITY) {
      if (p.second(c)) {
        x = p.first;
        break;
      }
    }
    if (x == 1) {
      return c;
      // ä¸ä¼šå§ä¸ä¼šå§ä¸ä¼šçœŸæœ‰ cf2000 å§
    }else if (x > 0) {
      priorityCandidates[x-2].push_back(c);
    }
  }
  
  for (candidatesList : priorityCandidates) {
    Candidate result;
    int prev = 0;
    for (c : candidatesList) {
      int x = conditionsMetCount(c);
      if (x == 4) {
        return c;
      }
      if (x > prev) {
        prev = x;
        result = c;
      }
    }
    if (result) {
      return result;
    }
  }
    
  vector<Candidate> conditionCandidates;
  for (c : candidates) {
    bool meetAllConditions = true;
    for (con : conditions) {
      meetAllConditions &= con(c);
    }
    if (meetAllConditions) {
      conditionCandidates.push_back(c);
    }
  }
  
  if (conditionCandidates.empty()) {
    throw error("æ²¡æœ‰æ‰¾åˆ°åˆé€‚çš„äººï¼");
  }
  
  sort(conditionCandidates, (a, b) => {
    for (f : finalJudging) {
      if (f(a) != f(b)) {
        return f(a) > f(b);
      }
    }
  });
  return conditionCandidates[0];
}

try {
  Candidate chosen = select(candidates);
  // å› ä¸º candidates æ•°ç»„æœ¬èº«å°±æ˜¯æŒ‰æ—¶é—´é¡ºåºæ’åºçš„ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æœ‰å‡ ä¸ªé»˜è®¤è¿”å›å‰è€…çš„æƒ…å†µã€‚
} catch () {
  cry();
}

æ³¨ï¼š

  • AI å‚ä¸å‘½åä¸å®¡é˜…ï¼ˆä½†å¾ˆå¤šæœ‰é“ç†çš„æˆ‘æ²¡æ”¹ï¼‰
  • æ„Ÿè§‰é€»è¾‘æœ‰ç‚¹å¤æ‚å¯è¯»æ€§æœ‰ç‚¹å·®ï¼Œå†™ä¼ªä»£ç å°±æ˜¯ä¸ºäº†ä¸€çœ¼çœ‹è¿‡å»å°±çœ‹æ˜ç™½æ€ä¹ˆå›äº‹ï¼ˆé¡ºä¾¿å·æ‡’+æ©ç›–è‡ªå·±å¾ˆå¤šåœ°æ–¹ä¼šå†™é”™ï¼‰ï¼Œä½†åŒæ—¶åˆéœ€è¦å¾ˆå¤šåˆ¤æ–­é€»è¾‘å¤„ç†å„ç§æƒ…å†µâ€¦â€¦><

item.content:encoded:
å›¢é˜Ÿæ‹“å±•æ–°ä¸šåŠ¡ï¼Œç°å¼€æ”¾æ‹›è˜å…¨èŒ C++å·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆå…¨èŒè¿œç¨‹å²—ä½ï¼Œè–ªèµ„èŒƒå›´ï¼š15-20K ã€‚

éœ€è¦å…·å¤‡ 5 å¹´ä»¥ä¸Š C++ç»éªŒï¼Œè‹±è¯­è¯»å†™èƒ½åŠ›æ˜¯å¿…è¦çš„ï¼Œå¬è¯´ä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªåŠ åˆ†é¡¹ã€‚

å²—ä½å…·ä½“ä»‹ç»å’Œè¦æ±‚å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled C++ Software Developer with a strong background in developing applications on Linux and expertise in Market Data systems. The ideal candidate will have experience working with Refinitiv Market Data System (RMDS) and OpenDACS, with a passion for building high-performance, low-latency software solutions.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain high-performance C++ applications for market data processing. Design and implement low-latency, scalable solutions for handling real-time market data. Work with RMDS and OpenDACS to manage data distribution and entitlement. Optimize system performance and troubleshoot real-time data issues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including infrastructure and trading teams, to enhance system reliability. Ensure software quality through code reviews, automated testing, and best practices. Stay updated with the latest market data technologies and trends.

Requirements:

  1. 5+ years of C++ development experience on Linux.
  2. 2+ years of experience working with Market Data.
  3. Strong knowledge of multithreading, networking (TCP/IP), and performance optimization.
  4. Experience with low-latency, high-throughput applications.
  5. Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Shell) is a plus.
  6. Knowledge of Refinitiv RMDS and OpenDACS is a plus.
  7. Familiarity with messaging protocols (e.g., FIX, Kafka, or similar) is an advantage.
  8. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  1. Experience in financial markets, trading systems, or related fields.
  2. Familiarity with cloud-based market data solutions.
  3. Strong debugging and profiling skills with tools like GDB, Valgrind, Perf.

åœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€é˜¶æ®µä¸­ä¼šåˆ¤æ–­ force_normal_bootï¼Œç„¶ååˆ›å»ºäº† /first_stage_ramdisk ï¼Œè¿›è¡Œäº†ä¸€äº›å‡†å¤‡å·¥ä½œï¼Œç„¶åé€šè¿‡ SwithRoot å°† /first_stage_ramdisk åˆ‡æ¢ä¸ºæ ¹ç›®å½•ã€‚

åé¢æ‰§è¡Œ fsm->DoFirstStageMount()ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œæ˜¯æ¯”è¾ƒå…³é”®çš„ä¸€æ­¥ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œä¼šè°ƒç”¨ MountPartitions è¿›è€Œåˆ°äº† FirstStageMountVBootV2::TrySwitchSystemAsRoot()ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªå‡½æ•°åšäº†ä¸‹é¢ä¸€äº›äº‹æƒ…ï¼š

// If system is in the fstab then we're not a system-as-root device, and in
// this case, we mount system first then pivot to it.  From that point on,
// we are effectively identical to a system-as-root device.
bool FirstStageMountVBootV2::TrySwitchSystemAsRoot() {
    UseDsuIfPresent();
    // Preloading all AVB keys from the ramdisk before switching root to /system.
    PreloadAvbKeys();

    auto system_partition = std::find_if(fstab_.begin(), fstab_.end(), [](const auto& entry) {
        return entry.mount_point == "/system";
    });

    if (system_partition == fstab_.end()) return true;

    if (use_snapuserd_) {
        SaveRamdiskPathToSnapuserd();
    }

    if (!MountPartition(system_partition, false /* erase_same_mounts */)) {
        PLOG(ERROR) << "Failed to mount /system";
        return false;
    }
    if (dsu_not_on_userdata_ && fs_mgr_verity_is_check_at_most_once(*system_partition)) {
        LOG(ERROR) << "check_at_most_once forbidden on external media";
        return false;
    }

    SwitchRoot("/system");

    return true;
}

void SwitchRoot(const std::string& new_root) {
    auto mounts = GetMounts(new_root);

    LOG(INFO) << "Switching root to '" << new_root << "'";

    for (const auto& mount_path : mounts) {
        auto new_mount_path = new_root + mount_path;
        mkdir(new_mount_path.c_str(), 0755);
        if (mount(mount_path.c_str(), new_mount_path.c_str(), nullptr, MS_MOVE, nullptr) != 0) {
            PLOG(FATAL) << "Unable to move mount at '" << mount_path << "' to "
                        << "'" << new_mount_path << "'";
        }
    }

    if (chdir(new_root.c_str()) != 0) {
        PLOG(FATAL) << "Could not chdir to new_root, '" << new_root << "'";
    }

    if (mount(new_root.c_str(), "/", nullptr, MS_MOVE, nullptr) != 0) {
        PLOG(FATAL) << "Unable to move root mount to new_root, '" << new_root << "'";
    }

    if (chroot(".") != 0) {
        PLOG(FATAL) << "Unable to chroot to new root";
    }
}

Please be advised that GitLab can no longer service GitLab.com accounts for individuals and organizations located in Mainland China, Macao, and Hong Kong. Our system indicates that you are visiting GitLab from one of these locations. We advise you to sign up with JiHu https://gitlab.cn/saasmigration/. JiHu is an independent company with a localized GitLab offering that has an exclusive right to provide GitLab to individuals and organizations located in this region. You must complete the transition by 24-02-2025, after which GitLab will delete your account from our systems. If you believe you are receiving this notification in error, please log in to GitLab.com from a supported service location. For further information or support, please feel free to contact saasmigration@gitlab.cn. Best Regards, GitLab Team

item.title: [Android] è¯·æ•™ä¸ª Jetpack Compose çš„å¸ƒå±€é—®é¢˜
item.content:encoded:
æˆ‘æƒ³åšä¸€ä¸ªç±»ä¼¼ç‰©æµçš„ä¸€ä¸ªé¡µé¢ç±»ä¼¼ä¸‹å›¾ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å·¦è¾¹é‚£æ¡ç»¿çº¿æ— æ³•æ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥ã€‚ï¼ˆä»£ç å’Œå›¾ç‰‡åœ¨åé¢ï¼‰

  1. Row(modifier = Modifier.height(IntrinsicSize.Min)) å¹¶ä¸”æŠŠå›¾ç‰‡ grid æ³¨é‡Šæ‰ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆç»¿çº¿æ˜¯æ­£å¸¸æ˜¾ç¤ºçš„
  2. Row(modifier = Modifier.fillMaxHeight)å¹¶ä¸”è®¾ç½® grid çš„ height ï¼Œä¹Ÿæ— æ³•æ˜¾ç¤º 
@Composable
fun ListDemo() {
    var titles = listOf("1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2","1","2")
    LazyColumn(modifier = Modifier
        .fillMaxSize()) {
        itemsIndexed(titles) { index, item ->
            Surface(modifier = Modifier
                .fillMaxWidth()) {
                Column(modifier = Modifier
                    .padding(horizontal = 18.dp)) {
                    Row(modifier = Modifier
                        .padding(vertical = 8.dp),
                        verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically) {
                        Box(modifier = Modifier
                            .size(24.dp)
                            .background(Color.Red))
                    }

                    Row(modifier = Modifier
                        .fillMaxWidth()) {
                        Box(modifier = Modifier
                            .width(24.dp)
                            .fillMaxHeight(IntrinsicSize.Min),
                            contentAlignment = Alignment.Center){
                            // TODO show this green line
                            Box(modifier = Modifier
                                .fillMaxHeight()
                                .width(1.dp)
                                .background(Color.Green))
                        }
                        Spacer(Modifier.width(8.dp))
                        Column(modifier = Modifier
                            .fillMaxWidth(),
                            verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp)) {
                            Row(modifier = Modifier
                                .fillMaxWidth()) {
                                Text(
                                    text = "Timeï¼š",
                                    fontSize = 14.sp,
                                    color = Color.Gray,
                                    modifier = Modifier
                                        .width(100.dp)
                                )
                                Spacer(Modifier.width(4.dp))
                                Text(
                                    text = "2023-03-02 18:34:07",
                                    fontSize = 14.sp,
                                    color = Color.Gray
                                )
                            }

                            val images = listOf("1","2","3","4")
                            LazyVerticalGrid(
                                columns = GridCells.Fixed(3),
                                horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(6.dp),
                                verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(6.dp),
                                modifier = Modifier.heightIn(
                                    max = 1000.dp)
                            ) {
                                items(images) { pic ->
                                    Box(
                                        modifier = Modifier
                                            .aspectRatio(1f)
                                            .background(Color.Gray)
                                    ) {
                                        Text(
                                            text = pic
                                        )
                                    }
                                }
                            }

                        }
                    }

                    Spacer(Modifier.height(8.dp))
                }


            }
        }
    }
}

@Preview
@Composable
fun ListDemoPreview() {
    ListDemo()
}

A = "aaa"

def main():
    print(A)
    for i in range(10):

        if b < i:

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

const label = "åˆ é™¤æ´»åŠ¨è®°å½•"
const container = document.querySelector('div.jkOv3d');
let lastClicked = null;
setInterval(() => {
    if (!container) return;
    const button = Array.from(container.querySelectorAll('button, [role="button"]'))
        .find(el =>
            el.getAttribute('aria-label')?.includes(label) &&
            getComputedStyle(el).display !== 'none' &&
            getComputedStyle(el).visibility !== 'hidden' &&
            el.offsetParent !== null
        );

    if (button && button !== lastClicked) {
        button.style.backgroundColor = '#ff0000';
        lastClicked = button;
        setTimeout(() => button.click(), 50);
    }
}, 100);
setInterval(() => {
    if (!container) return;
    const button = Array.from(container.querySelectorAll('button, [role="button"]'))
        .find(el =>
            el.getAttribute('aria-label')?.includes(label) &&
            getComputedStyle(el).display !== 'none' &&
            getComputedStyle(el).visibility !== 'hidden' &&
            el.offsetParent !== null
        );
    if (button === undefined) {
        window.scrollTo({ top: document.body.scrollHeight, behavior: "smooth" });
    }
}, 3000);

item.title: [ç¨‹åºå‘˜] ChatGPT å…³äº AppleScript çš„çŸ¥è¯†æ¼æ´
item.content:encoded:
ä»Šå¤©ç»™ gpt æäº†ä¸€ä¸ªé—®é¢˜

åœ¨ macOS ä¸Šçš„é‚®ä»¶ï¼Œå¦‚ä½•åœ¨æ”¶åˆ°é‚®ä»¶æ—¶è‡ªåŠ¨è§¦å‘å¹¶è¯†åˆ«ä¿¡ç”¨å¡è´¦å•ï¼Œè§£æ eml å†…å®¹ï¼Œè¾“å‡ºæˆ csv æ–‡ä»¶

ta ä¹Ÿç»™å‡ºäº†æ­£ç¡®çš„æ€è·¯ï¼Œå…³é”®çš„ä¸€æ­¥æ˜¯â€œåœ¨ Apple Mail é‡Œè®¾ç½®è§„åˆ™ï¼Œå½“ç¬¦åˆç‰¹å®šæ¡ä»¶ï¼ˆå¦‚é‚®ä»¶æ¥è‡ªé“¶è¡Œæˆ–æ ‡é¢˜åŒ…å«â€œä¿¡ç”¨å¡è´¦å•â€ï¼‰æ—¶ï¼Œè§¦å‘ AppleScriptâ€ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å°±æ˜¯è¿™ä¸€æ­¥å¡äº†æˆ‘å¥½ä¹…ã€‚

on perform_mail_action(theMailMessages)
    tell application "Mail"
        repeat with eachMessage in theMailMessages
            set senderAddress to sender of eachMessage
            set subjectLine to subject of eachMessage
            
            -- åªå¤„ç†æ¥è‡ªé“¶è¡Œçš„ä¿¡ç”¨å¡è´¦å•é‚®ä»¶
            if senderAddress contains "bank@example.com" and subjectLine contains "ä¿¡ç”¨å¡è´¦å•" then
                set emlFilePath to (POSIX path of (path to desktop)) & "bills/" & subjectLine & ".eml"
                
                -- ç¡®ä¿ç›®å½•å­˜åœ¨
                do shell script "mkdir -p " & quoted form of (POSIX path of (path to desktop) & "bills")
                
                -- å¯¼å‡ºé‚®ä»¶
                save eachMessage in file emlFilePath
            end if
        end repeat
    end tell
end perform_mail_action

ä½†æ˜¯å°è¯•ä¹‹åï¼Œä¸€ç›´çœ‹ä¸åˆ°å¯¼å‡ºé‚®ä»¶ã€‚ç»§ç»­è¿½é—®ï¼ŒChatGPT æå‡ºå¯èƒ½æ˜¯è®¿é—®æƒé™çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Ÿä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘åŠ å…¥äº†å®Œæ•´ç£ç›˜è®¿é—®æƒé™ä¹‹åä¾æ—§å¦‚æ•…ã€‚

æœ€ååœ¨ https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59791464/how-to-trigger-applescript-on-apple-mail-rule æ‰¾åˆ°å¯è¡Œçš„åŠæ³•ã€‚

using terms from application "Mail"
    on perform mail action with messages caughtMessages for rule catchingRule
        repeat with caughtMessage in caughtMessages
            try
                set mailSubject to subject of caughtMessage
                display dialog mailSubject
            on error errorString number errorNumber
                display dialog errorString
            end try
        end repeat
    end perform mail action with messages
end using terms from

    irCameraManager.setOnDeviceStatuesCallBack(new UsbCameraManager.OnDeviceStatuesCallBack() {
        @Override
        public void onAttach(UsbDevice device) {
        }

        @Override
        public void onDeviceOpen(UsbDevice device, boolean isFirstOpen) {

         }
    });

    irCameraManager.setPreviewHeight(PREVIEW_HEIGHT);
    irCameraManager.setFrameCallback(frame -> {
        Size currentPreviewSize = irCameraManager.getCurrentPreviewSize();
        int width = PREVIEW_WIDTH;
        int height = PREVIEW_HEIGHT;
        if (currentPreviewSize != null) {
            width = currentPreviewSize.width;
            height = currentPreviewSize.height;
        }
        Bitmap bitmap = DataConvertUtils.NV21Data2Bitmap(frame, width, height, 0, 0, false);
        if (bitmap != null) {
            faceVerifySetBitmap(bitmap, FaceVerifyUtils.BitmapType.IR);
        }
    }, UVCCamera.PIXEL_FORMAT_NV21);
}

item.title: [å¼€æº] Dock Video Player
item.content:encoded:
Introduction / ç®€ä»‹

A program that plays videos in the Mac Dock bar by utilizing the Dock icon dynamic replacement API.

åˆ©ç”¨ Dock å›¾æ ‡åŠ¨æ€æ›¿æ¢ API ï¼Œå®ç°çš„ä¸€æ¬¾åœ¨ Mac Dock æ æ’­æ”¾è§†é¢‘çš„ç¨‹åºã€‚

Usage Guide / ä½¿ç”¨æ•™ç¨‹

  1. Run npm install to install dependencies
  2. Run npm start to launch the Electron application
  3. Load a video
  4. Click play to see the video displayed in the Dock bar
  5. The repository includes a BadApple sample video. For the best experience, set audio playback to 1x speed and start it 0.2 seconds earlier

  4. ç‚¹å‡»æ’­æ”¾å³å¯åœ¨ Dock æ ä¸­çœ‹åˆ°è§†é¢‘ç”»é¢
